comment: She is an amazing professor, and her course was very mandible and easy. The homework every week normally goes like: a quiz, some notes, quick assignment. I always left it for the last day and was never overwhelmed by the workload. there his only one test and that is a final, but if you get over a 70 on the assessment you don't have a final.

Professor Clack was amazing! She made lectures easy to follow along with guided notes and she assigned homework and quizzes after each class that were very easy and would always be willing to help. She even allowed us to exempt the final exam. All assignments, including tests, were very straightforward. Show up and listen and you will make an A!

God Bless Ms. Clack. I never thought I was capable of an A in math until her course. She is SO sweet and allowed me all the time I needed to complete assignments after getting very sick and having a family emergency. If math is your worst subject, take her. As long as you put in even minimal effort, you will succeed amazingly. Open book, open note.

Super easy course! Each week on ALEKS you had to watch 3-5 videos only 3-5 minutes a piece, homework, and take a quiz over the material from the previous week. She also created fill in the blank notes that followed along with the videos she assigned. Along with each quiz, there was an extra credit practice quiz on D2L. Clack sets you up for success
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly the most extra credit opportunities I've ever had in a college course!! I cannot recommend this professor enough. Assessments due every Sunday are very manageable. You can even exempt the final exam!

I took the course online and it consisted of Aleks videos, homework, and quizzes each week. The material isn't super difficult and she offers bonus points from quizzes on D2L. If you need a course that you can go at your own pace I definitely recommend this one.

If you struggle with math, this is the teacher for you!! I finished this class with a 104 due to how many extra credit activities she gives. All work is open note and chapter quizzes can be taken as many times as you need to earn 100. Exams are also open note and she lets you take a practice exam for extra credit before you take the real thing.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: So this class was online, so she didn't really teach. You learn everything thorough aleks (which I hate aleks but that isn't the point here). You can retake the homework until you get an A, all tests and quizzes are open note, and she does extra credit quizzes for each chapter. I suck at math but her class structure is why I passed.

Class itself is easy and Im not a math person at all. ALEKS explains everything simply and your calculator will do the heavy work. Cayes resources and explanations didnt really help me but shes nice and does gives lots of extra credit. No proctoring and I was able to exempt the final.

I LOVED THIS ONLINE CLASS!!!! TAKE IF FOR AN EASY A!!!! LOADS of extra credit opportunities practically every week. As long as you do the work and take some notes, this class will be a breeze for you.

Toughest class ever, i put a lot of work and spent a lot of time for a class i won't use. The tests are easy but her grading is soo confusing, so if you have another opportunity to take someone do it, she is not good teacher!

IF MATH ISN'T YOUR STRONGEST SUBJECT, TAKE THIS PROFESSOR'S CLASS. All assignments through ALEKS, there were printable notes for each section on D2L, workload wasn't heavy, tons of extra credit, open note tests and quizzes (not proctored). Statistics isn't easy, but if you take good notes and make the weekly Sunday deadlines it's an easy A.

This class was very easy and it would be very hard to fail. Not only were the notes directly correlated with the homework and tests, but this professor gave so much extra credit to potentially raise your grade. I highly recommend taking this class, easy A!

She made stats easier than I thought it would be. Quizzes are open notes and she gave practice quizzes, which also counted for extra credit. I was able to exempt the midterm and final exam. It's hard not to pass her class so definitely take her if you can. We also had weekly homework but you get multiple chances to get questions correct.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Didn't expect to get an A in a math class until professor Clack came into my life! Was able to exempt both the midterm and final exams! She offers extra credit and partial credit. Very hard NOT to get an A with her in STAT1401. Almost everything is done in the online program ALEXS.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Cant say enough about Dr. Clack. Kind, informative, understanding, and is such a breath of fresh air. OPEN NOTE EXAMS!! She is extremely sweet, while still getting things done in the classroom. Attendance is mandatory. Assignments are pretty straightforward, as well as tests. Final project was the only super extensive assignment. Amazing choice!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance not required, but you'll forfeit a letter grade. You know from syllabus what is expected the entire class and can plan as needed. She provides the codes to duplicate/apply to tests and quizzes. It may not be the best way to memorize coding, but many of the students are not CS majors.

This lady is the bomb. com! She prints out clear, very helpful notes for you and is very easy to understand. She reasonable in her assignments and gives you 2x more the amount of resources you need to do well. Took her during the COVID situation and she was still amazing then.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very sweet lady, and good professor too. She is very helpful and doesn't expect too much like some professors. I took Hardy's Stats II class, so this was a breeze as I feel like Hardy really prepares you well for this course. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a super great teacher. I had a few technical problems with the online homework and Professor Clack worked with me to fix it. Easy to understand lectures and quizzes that are literally ripped from the class notes that you can use. The midterm and final are easy as well, she allows a cheat sheet for both of them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: professor clack was the best!! she made her class so fun and it was definitely one of the easiest classes i have taken. the notes are fill in the blank and you can use them on all the quizzes. for the midterm you can use the front and back of a piece of copy paper as a cheat sheet! take her if you can!!!!

Prof. Clack cares more about you understanding the material than her just giving it to you. For the most part, as long as you show up the class, take notes, and do your homework, this class should be easy. She is even flexible with makeup dates for tests and "labs" (worksheets). You can use a note card on every test (final included).

Professor Clack is great! She understands that she's not teaching math students, so don't stress out. She lets you use 5x7" note cards for every test and your notes on quizzes. "Labs" are like worksheets that you can work together on. As long as you don't forget to write down the vocabulary, this class should be an easy pass!
She's an awesome professor! The material wasn't too hard and she makes it easy to understand! Just study and ask her questions on things you don't understand and you should be fine :)

Love this professor! Beware of labs in class that will make coming to class a necessity if you want to do good. She is a very fair grader and is such a sweet older lady. I am not good at math but she made it easy and understandable. The homework is super easy and the test are not that bad!

I absolutely adore her. She gives off strong "grandma" vibes and is always happy to help with a smile. I usually struggle with math, but I found myself having an easy time in her class. Super understanding and very thorough. Highly recommend her.

I am not good at math and I got an A. She understand that not everyone is going to be a statistics master. She sets you up to succeed. Make sure you show up to class for the labs. Attendance does matter. She lets you use a note card for most tests (for formulas) which is nice! I would take her again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I get anxiety about math and if you want a good semester and a super easy class then take her. You will not get a bad grade no matter how bad at this stuff you are. Cheat sheets can be used on tests and alot of the grades are done with partners. HW every week but is easy and takes 10 minutes

She lets you use open note on quizzes and cheat sheets for tests but is awful teacher she literally stands at front of class and reads off power point. and if you have a question she just looks at you and keeps moving... she avoids any type of confrontation and doesn't respond to emails when you have questions. Lazy and unhelpful

She's super helpful! She provided fill in the blank class notes, open notes quizzes & cheat sheet for ALL test. Her class is really easy. Attendance is mandatory. She's flexitble and understanding. If you miss a homework she'll allow you to make it up. Her test are straight forward and simple. Don't buy book, buy statsportal.

Incredibly easy class. Fill in the blank notes everyday, and 4 tests that are based on what you learn exactly - no surprises or trick questions. You get out of class early a lot. Don't but the textbook, just get the online Stats Portal because you need it for homework. Attendance is a grade. I got a 100 and exempted the final as did several others.

I was not so excited about statistics when I first came but it wasn't bad with her.  She is willing to help and provides clear notes for her students.  Make sure you are there for each class or you will get behind.  Tests aren't hard but you need to make sure you understand the concepts.

She is so helpful!! She is very flexible with her schedule and is willing to help you one on one. She answers emails promptly and will help you with math over emails. She is not good with the graphing calculator which is annoying when you yourself are trying to learn to use it but overall I totally recommend her!
